title: For Patients: VACO Index COVID-19 Mortality Risk
description: Estimates 30-day mortality risk after COVID-19 infection using pre-existing health conditions and demographics. Developed by researchers from Yale University and VA Connecticut Healthcare System in collaboration with the US Department of Health and Human Services.

parameters.name: diabetes
parameters.description: Diabetes mellitus status and severity (0-2 points)

parameters.name: renal_disease
parameters.description: Kidney/renal disease status and severity (0-2 points)

parameters.name: liver_disease
parameters.description: Liver disease status and severity (0-3 points)

result.name: mortality_risk
result.description: 30-day mortality risk percentage after COVID-19 infection

ranges.interpretation: Lower risk of death within 30 days of COVID-19 infection. Continue standard preventive measures and consult healthcare provider if symptoms develop.
Moderate risk of death within 30 days of COVID-19 infection. Enhanced preventive measures recommended. Seek medical attention promptly if COVID-19 symptoms develop.
High risk of death within 30 days of COVID-19 infection. Strict preventive measures strongly recommended. Consider discussing additional protective strategies with healthcare provider.
Extreme risk of death within 30 days of COVID-19 infection. Maximum preventive measures essential. Immediate medical consultation recommended for risk mitigation strategies.

references: Justice AC, Freiburg MS, Lopez-Class M, et al. Patient-facing COVID-19 risk tool. Developed in collaboration with US Department of Health and Human Services. Yale University and VA Connecticut Healthcare System; 2020.

King JT Jr, Yoon JS, Rentsch CT, et al. Development and validation of a 30-day mortality index based on pre-existing medical administrative data from 13,323 COVID-19 patients: The Veterans Health Administration COVID-19 (VACO) Index. PLoS One. 2020;15(11):e0241825.
Rentsch CT, Kidwai-Khan F, Tate JP, et al. Patterns of COVID-19 testing and mortality by race and ethnicity among United States veterans: A nationwide cohort study. PLoS Med. 2020;17(9):e1003379.
formula: Uses age-specific coefficients, sex coefficients, and Charlson Comorbidity Index points with interaction terms. Final risk = exp(coefficient_sum) / (1 + exp(coefficient_sum))
notes: This calculator estimates mortality risk based on pre-existing health conditions and does not predict risk of contracting COVID-19
Risk estimates are based on data from veterans and may not be fully generalizable to all populations
Mortality risk is 8-12 times higher than seasonal influenza mortality
Does not measure potential long-term health effects from COVID-19 infection
Results should be interpreted in consultation with healthcare professionals
Developed for patient-facing use to help individuals understand their risk profile
